DataElement.preferredName: Patient Quality of Life Consent Withdrawn Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to capture an explanation a participant withdrew from the Quality of Life (QOL) portion of a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Quality of Life Consent Withdrawn Consent Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's withdrawal (when the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn) of consent for a companion study (a study that is secondary to another study) involving quality of life (the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life)._When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Ancillary Study Quality of Life Consent Withdrawn Reason
Property.preferredDefinition: Studies which are secondary to another study.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A study that is secondary to another study.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Withdrawal Quality of Life Consent Reason
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

PermissibleValues.value: I am not comfortable with the questions being asked

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply; a request for information (e.g., a formal request to a database or search engine).: A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress.

Concepts.definition: A sentence of inquiry that asks for a reply; a request for information (e.g., a formal request to a database or search engine).
A feeling of mental or physical uneasiness, pain, or distress.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.value: The questionnaires are too time consuming

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual finds the questionnaires to be too time consuming.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual finds the questionnaires to be too time consuming.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/5/23 Added concept to VM per cleanup efforts cjl.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative

ReferenceDocuments.name: Reason for withdrawal from Qu
ReferenceDocuments.description: Reason for withdrawal from Quality of Life portion of study
